intro: Pouzolzia procridioides, commonly known as the African mistletoe, is a hemiparasitic plant that grows on the branches of various host trees. It belongs to the family Loranthaceae and is native to parts of Africa, including South Africa. The plant has small, opposite leaves and produces small, white or yellowish flowers. Its berries are typically red or orange and contain seeds that are dispersed by birds. Due to its parasitic nature, it can weaken its host tree if left unchecked.
